tspan: The symbols in the background are of course those of the three zodiac
The King’s chair is a stick-figure version of the Aeron, designed by
Chadwick and William Stumpf in 1992. As well as having a name
of air, the Aristotlian element associated the suit of
the Aeron was one of the potent symbols of the
boom of the late 1990s (and the sale of Aerons
E-bay was one of the potent symbols of the dot-com collapse in the
2000s)—and the suit of Swords governs intellectual activity.
